trans-unit.source: Represents the root element of a ribbon user interface that hosts a Quick Access Toolbar, Application Menu, and tabs.
A ribbon is a command bar that organizes the features of an application into a series of tabs at the top of the application window.
It replaces both the traditional menu bar and toolbars.
The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.Ribbon> class is the root element of a ribbon user interface (UI) in Windows Presentation Foundation (WPF).

The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.Ribbon> class hosts a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonQuickAccessToolBar>, a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonApplicationMenu>, and one or more <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonTab> controls.
These controls then host a variety of button and menu controls that enable access to application commands.
The following list shows the typical hierarchy of ribbon elements.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.Ribbon"></xref> class.
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonApplicationMenu"></xref> that is a logical child of this <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.Ribbon"></xref> control.

You use the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.Ribbon.ApplicationMenu%2A> property to associate a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonApplicationMenu> object with the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.Ribbon>.
The ribbon Application Menu that is a logical child of this <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.Ribbon"></xref> control.
For more information about what can influence the value, see [Dependency Property Value Precedence](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/dependency-property-value-precedence.md).
Gets or sets the brush that is used to draw the background of <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.Ribbon"></xref> controls when they are in the Checked state.
The brush that is used to draw the background of <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.Ribbon"></xref> controls when they are in the Checked state.
For more information about what can influence the value, see [Dependency Property Value Precedence](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/dependency-property-value-precedence.md).
Gets or sets the brush that is used to draw the outer border of <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.Ribbon"></xref> controls when they are in the Checked state.
The brush that is used to draw the outer border of <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.Ribbon"></xref> controls when they are in the Checked state.
For more information about what can influence the value, see [Dependency Property Value Precedence](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/dependency-property-value-precedence.md).
Occurs when the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.Ribbon.IsCollapsed"></xref> property is changed to `true` and the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.Ribbon"></xref> is collapsed.

Gets or sets the template that is used to display <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonContextualTabGroup.Header"></xref> items in the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonContextualTabGroup"></xref>.

The template that is used to display <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonContextualTabGroup.Header"></xref> items in the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonContextualTabGroup"></xref>.
For more information about what can influence the value, see [Dependency Property Value Precedence](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/dependency-property-value-precedence.md).
Gets a collection that contains all of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonContextualTabGroup"></xref> items in the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.Ribbon"></xref>.
You use a *contextual tab* to display groups of commands that are relevant only in a particular context.
Contextual tab groups are shown or hidden based on specified criteria.
For example, an Ink Tools tab group might be shown when tablet input is detected, or a Picture Tools tab group might be shown when an Image object is selected.

The collection of <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonContextualTabGroup"></xref> items in the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.Ribbon"></xref> if one exists; otherwise, a new empty collection.
Gets or sets a collection used to generate the content of <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonContextualTabGroup"></xref> items.
A collection used to generate the content of <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonContextualTabGroup"></xref> items.
For more information about what can influence the value, see [Dependency Property Value Precedence](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/dependency-property-value-precedence.md).

Gets or sets the style that is used when rendering <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonContextualTabGroup"></xref> items in the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.Ribbon"></xref>.
The style applied to all <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonContextualTabGroup"></xref> items in the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.Ribbon"></xref>.
For more information about what can influence the value, see [Dependency Property Value Precedence](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/dependency-property-value-precedence.md).
Occurs when the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.Ribbon.IsCollapsed"></xref> property is changed to `false` and the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.Ribbon"></xref> is expanded.
Gets or sets the brush used to draw the background of <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.Ribbon"></xref> controls in the Focused state.
The brush used to draw the background of <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.Ribbon"></xref> controls in the Focused state.
For more information about what can influence the value, see [Dependency Property Value Precedence](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/dependency-property-value-precedence.md).
Gets or sets the brush used to draw the outer border of <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.Ribbon"></xref> controls in the Focused state.
To place keyboard focus on a ribbon control, press ALT+KeyTip letter and navigate with the ARROW keys.
The brush used to draw the outer border of <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.Ribbon"></xref> controls in the Focused state.
For more information about what can influence the value, see [Dependency Property Value Precedence](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/dependency-property-value-precedence.md).

A new <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonTab"></xref> container object that is used to display an item from the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.Items"></xref> collection.
Gets or sets the contents of the help pane.
You can set the contents of the help pane to enable users to access help content for your application.
You will typically set the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.Ribbon.HelpPaneContent%2A> property to a single button that launches a separate help window.
However, you can define any content to go in the help pane.
You can specify the layout and appearance of the content by setting the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.Ribbon.HelpPaneContentTemplate%2A> property.
The contents of the help pane.
For more information about what can influence the value, see [Dependency Property Value Precedence](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/dependency-property-value-precedence.md).
Gets or sets the template that is used to display the content of the help pane.
The template that is used to display the content of the help pane.
For more information about what can influence the value, see [Dependency Property Value Precedence](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/dependency-property-value-precedence.md).
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.Ribbon"></xref> is collapsed.
The ribbon collapses automatically when the application window is resized and does not have enough space to display the ribbon in a meaningful way.
When the ribbon is collapsed, all ribbon elements are hidden from view.
When the ribbon is collapsed, the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.Ribbon.Collapsed> event occurs.
When the ribbon is expanded, the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.Ribbon.Expanded> event occurs.
For more information about what can influence the value, see [Dependency Property Value Precedence](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/dependency-property-value-precedence.md).
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the drop-down for a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonTab"></xref> is open.

When the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.Ribbon.IsMinimized%2A> property is `true`, the Quick Access Toolbar, Application Menu, and tab headers are shown, but the tab contents are put in a drop-down and are not shown by default.
When a user selects a tab header, the drop-down for the tab is opened and its contents are shown.
Selecting or deselecting the tab header toggles the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.Ribbon.IsDropDownOpen%2A> property between `true` and `false`.
If the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.Ribbon.IsMinimized%2A> property is `false`, the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.Ribbon.IsDropDownOpen%2A> property is also `false`.
`true` if the drop-down for a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonTab"></xref> is open; otherwise, `false`.
For more information about what can influence the value, see [Dependency Property Value Precedence](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/dependency-property-value-precedence.md).
Gets a value that indicates whether the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.Ribbon"></xref> is currently hosted in a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonWindow"></xref>.
`true` if the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.Ribbon"></xref> is hosted in a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonWindow"></xref>; otherwise, `false`.
For more information about what can influence the value, see [Dependency Property Value Precedence](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/dependency-property-value-precedence.md).
Returns a value that indicates whether the specified item is (or is eligible to be) its own container.
`true` if the item is a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonTab"></xref>; otherwise, `false`.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.Ribbon"></xref> is minimized.
A user can minimize the ribbon by right-clicking the ribbon and selecting **Minimize the Ribbon** from the context menu.

When the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.Ribbon.IsMinimized%2A> property is `true`, the Quick Access Toolbar, Application Menu, and tab headers are shown, but the tab contents are put in a drop-down and are not shown by default.
When a user selects a tab header, the drop-down for the tab is opened and its contents are shown.

If the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.Ribbon.IsMinimized%2A> property is `true`, selecting or deselecting the tab header toggles the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.Ribbon.IsDropDownOpen%2A> property between `true` and `false`.
If the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.Ribbon.IsMinimized%2A> property is `false`, the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.Ribbon.IsDropDownOpen%2A> property is also `false`.
For more information about what can influence the value, see [Dependency Property Value Precedence](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/dependency-property-value-precedence.md).
Gets an <xref href="System.Collections.IEnumerator"></xref> that iterates through the child elements of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.Ribbon"></xref>.
Gets or sets the brush that is used to draw the background of <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.Ribbon"></xref> controls when they are in the MouseOver state.
The brush that is used to draw the background of <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.Ribbon"></xref> controls when they are in the MouseOver state.
For more information about what can influence the value, see [Dependency Property Value Precedence](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/dependency-property-value-precedence.md).
Gets or sets the brush that is used to draw the outer border of <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.Ribbon"></xref> controls when they are in the MouseOver state.
The brush that is used to draw the outer border of <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.Ribbon"></xref> controls when they are in the MouseOver state.
For more information about what can influence the value, see [Dependency Property Value Precedence](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/dependency-property-value-precedence.md).
Builds the visual tree for the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.Ribbon"></xref> when a new template is applied.
This method is invoked whenever application code or an internal process, such as a rebuilding layout pass, calls the <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.ApplyTemplate%2A> method.
Creates a new <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.RibbonAutomationPeer"></xref> object for this control.
A new automation peer object for this control.
Updates the current selection and synchronizes the headers when an item is changed in the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.Ribbon"></xref>.
Provides class handling for the <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement.KeyDown"></xref> event.
Provides class handling for the <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement.MouseDown"></xref> event.
Provides class handling for the <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement.PreviewMouseDown"></xref> event.
Provides class handling for the <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement.MouseWheel"></xref> event.
Spinning the mouse wheel while the mouse pointer is over the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.Ribbon> causes the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.Ribbon> to switch between tabs.
This implementation marks the <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.MouseWheel> event as handled by setting the <xref:System.Windows.RoutedEventArgs.Handled%2A> property of the event data to `true`.
Provides class handling for the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Selector.SelectionChanged"></xref> event.
This method enforces single-selection in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.Ribbon>.
Prepares the specified element to display the specified item.
The element used to display the item.
The item to display from the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.Items"></xref> collection.
Gets or sets the brush that is used to draw the background of <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.Ribbon"></xref> controls when they are in the Pressed state.
The brush that is used to draw the background of <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.Ribbon"></xref> controls when they are in the Pressed state.
For more information about what can influence the value, see [Dependency Property Value Precedence](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/dependency-property-value-precedence.md).
Gets or sets the brush that is used to draw the outer border of <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.Ribbon"></xref> controls when they are in the Pressed state.
The brush that is used to draw the outer border of <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.Ribbon"></xref> controls when they are in the Pressed state.
For more information about what can influence the value, see [Dependency Property Value Precedence](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/dependency-property-value-precedence.md).
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonQuickAccessToolBar"></xref> that is a logical child of this <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.Ribbon"></xref>.
The Quick Access Toolbar that is the logical child of this <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.Ribbon"></xref> control.
For more information about what can influence the value, see [Dependency Property Value Precedence](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/dependency-property-value-precedence.md).
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to show the Quick Access Toolbar above the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.Ribbon"></xref>.

`true` if the Quick Access Toolbar is shown above the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.Ribbon"></xref>; `false` if the Quick Access Toolbar is shown below the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.Ribbon"></xref>.
For more information about what can influence the value, see [Dependency Property Value Precedence](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/dependency-property-value-precedence.md).
Gets or sets the style that is used when rendering tab headers.
The style that is used when rendering tab headers.
For more information about what can influence the value, see [Dependency Property Value Precedence](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/dependency-property-value-precedence.md).
Gets or sets the template that is used to display tab headers.
The template that is used to display tab headers.
For more information about what can influence the value, see [Dependency Property Value Precedence](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/dependency-property-value-precedence.md).
Gets or sets the title of this <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.Ribbon"></xref> control.

You will typically set the <xref:System.Windows.Window.Title%2A> property on the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonWindow> instead of setting the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.Ribbon.Title%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property.

The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.Ribbon.Title%2A?displayProperty=fullName> is shown in the title bar of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonWindow> if the <xref:System.Windows.Window.Title%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonWindow> is `null`.

If the <xref:System.Windows.Window.Title%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property is not `null`, the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonWindow> title is shown instead of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.Ribbon.Title%2A?displayProperty=fullName> value.

If the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.Ribbon> is hosted in a <xref:System.Windows.Window> instead of a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonWindow>, the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.Ribbon.Title%2A?displayProperty=fullName> is shown next to the Quick Access Toolbar, below the <xref:System.Windows.Window.Title%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
For more information about what can influence the value, see [Dependency Property Value Precedence](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/dependency-property-value-precedence.md).
Gets or sets the template that is used to display the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.Ribbon"></xref> title.
The template that is used to display the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.Ribbon"></xref> title.
For more information about what can influence the value, see [Dependency Property Value Precedence](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/dependency-property-value-precedence.md).

Gets or sets the <xref href="System.Windows.Visibility"></xref> for the icon of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonWindow"></xref> that contains this <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.Ribbon"></xref>.
One of the enumeration values that specifies the visibility of the icon.
For more information about what can influence the value, see [Dependency Property Value Precedence](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/dependency-property-value-precedence.md).
